Hi! I'm Julian,

Frontend developer. Average rust enjoyer.

Right now getting into local-first applications, take a look at Sittly launcher and Tsxperiment. I'm testing the limits of what can be done with Rust and Web technologies in my free time.

Tech stack

In my daily basis I use some kind ofMERN but without the M, so it's more like ERN. I don't believe infullstackterm but it's the best way to describe my current position.

I'm a big fan ofRustand I'm trying to use it as much as I can. I've found an interesting merge of both worlds: Rust and Web calledTauri. Take a look at projects section to see whatI've done with it.

  • Frontend: Tauri, React, Typescript, Storybook, TailwindCSS, SASS, CSS, HTML, Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress plus a thousand libraries that I don't remember.
  • In-between: Rust, Tauri, Astro.
  • Backend: NodeJS, Express.
  • Bundlers/transpilers: Webpack, Rollup, Vite, Esbuild.
  • Integrations: Auth0.
  • Monitoring: Datadog, Newrelic.
  • CI/CD: Github Actions, Jenkins.
  • Testing: Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress.
  • Other: Git, Github, Docker, Linux, Bash, Zsh, Figma, Jira.

Projects

  1. TSXperiment - similar to RunJS a javascript live playground.
  2. Sittly launcher - a launcher like Raycast.
  3. gnome-dbus-api - grew as a need for Sittly Launcher. A rust library to interact with low-level gnome DBUS. API
  4. rust-benchmarks - a collection of benchmarks for rust experiments.
